summary: chipotle has decided to tap into the $ 70 billion food delivery market by teaming up with an app to bring burritos straight to customers ' doors . the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge - with the delivery fees for postmates beginning at $ 5 and up depending on distance and demand .

aspect: 1. Chipotle has teamed up with an app to offer food delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities.
2. Chipotle has decided to tap into the $70 billion food delivery market by working with Postmates app.
3. Chipotle has added a nine per cent service charge for delivery fees through Postmates, with rates starting at $5 and up depending on distance and demand.
4. Chipotle has previously turned down offers of collaboration with third-party delivery services but has now given Postmates the green light.
5. The app uses independent contractors who drive their own cars, similar to Uber taxis.
6. Chipotle has become popular in recent years and two presidential candidates have been seen in its restaurants.
7. Chipotle is not the only franchise hoping to cash in on the delivery market, with Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King also testing delivery services.
8. Celebrities like Hillary Clinton and Marco Rubio are customers of Chipotle.
explain: Chipotle has teamed up with an app, specifically Postmates, to offer food delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities.

The given aspect is that Chipotle has made a decision to tap into the $70 billion food delivery market by collaborating with the Postmates app. This means that the fast-casual chain wants to reach the customers who prefer to have their food delivered to their doorsteps, instead of dining-in at the restaurant. By partnering with Postmates, a popular on-demand delivery app, they aim to make their service available for customers in 67 cities and charge a 9% service charge along with delivery fees starting from $5 depending on distance and demand.

Chipotle has added a nine per cent service charge for delivery fees through Postmates, with rates starting at $5 and up depending on distance and demand. The aspect explains that Chipotle has decided to charge an additional service fee of nine per cent for delivery orders placed through the Postmates app. This service charge is in addition to the delivery fees, which start at $5 and can vary depending on the distance and demand for delivery in a specific area. This aspect highlights Chipotle's efforts to tap into the food delivery market and their collaboration with Postmates to offer delivery services to customers.
Chipotle has previously refused to collaborate with third-party delivery services but has now decided to partner with Postmates.

Chipotle's delivery service will be facilitated by Postmates, an app that uses independent contractors who drive their own cars to deliver food and other items. This is similar to Uber's business model in which drivers use their personal vehicles to transport passengers.
This aspect talks about the popularity of Chipotle among the masses and the high profile patronage it has received from two presidential candidates.

The given aspect talks about how Chipotle is not the only franchise that is trying to cash in on the delivery market. It mentions other franchises like Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King that are also testing delivery services. This indicates that the food delivery market is becoming increasingly popular and more and more franchises are trying to take advantage of it.

Chipotle is a popular fast-casual chain known for its delicious burritos and other Mexican dishes. Over the years, the restaurant has gained a large number of customers, including politicians like Hillary Clinton and Marco Rubio, who are known to enjoy Chipotle's food. This shows that Chipotle is not just a regular fast-food chain, but a destination for great tasting and nutritious meals. By expanding its delivery service through partnerships with app-based platforms like Postmates, the restaurant aims to reach new customers who prefer to have their meals delivered to their doors. With its fresh and made-to-order menu, Chipotle is sure to win over more fans with its delicious and convenient food delivery service.
